resources.string: All rights reserved to Nexi Group

Get closer to your customers with analytics data.
The app MyPayments gives merchants a quick overview of their business, with the opportunity to keep track of key figures in all imaginable time spans.

With the app, you as a merchant can check up on daily turnover and compare it to previous periods. You can see which was the busiest hour during the week, in order to plan for staffing. You can get valuable insights about customers, e.g. the number of recurring customers and the number of foreign customers and which country they are from.

All valuable insights about your business at the tip of your fingers.
Average purchase, new and recurring customers
Average price, related to number of visits:
Number of transactions, related to number of visits:
Number of transactions by recurring customers
Turnover, related to number of visits:
Turnover from new and recurring customers

In order to have access to this section, you must have concluded an international acquiring agreement with Nets.

Congratulations, your request for access to Nets MyPayments has been approved.

You have asked for access to the Nets MyPayments app. In order to log in, please enter the below code in the app.

>{0}<

The code is valid for 10 hours and can only be used once.

If you have not requested access to see your payment data in the Nets MyPayments app, you can discard this email.

Replies sent to this email address will not be answered.

Dear {0},

{1} has asked for access to see data for {2} ({3}) in the Nets MyPayments app. As you are registered in MyNets as administrator for this company ID, you receive this e-mail. If you want to grant access for this person to see data in the app, please forward the below code:

Code {4}.

The code is valid for 10 hours and can only be used once.

{5} asks for access to see data for

Company: {6} – {7}

    {8}
If you have any questions to the above, please contact Nets Customer Service on the following number: (+46) 771 22 00 55.

Replies sent to this email address will not be answered.

• When is my data available in the app?You can see your transaction and settlement data in the app at 16:00 the day after the transactions. The statistics data will be available at 10:00.
  • Where can I find more details on my settlement?Please log in to MyNets on my.nets.eu/portal to find more details on your settlement.
  • How do I get access to the web portal MyNets ?MyNets can be accessed here: my.nets.eu/portal.
  • Can others see my data if they know my company organisation number?It is only possible to access the app if the administrator has provided access. You cannot log in just by typing the company organisation number.
  • How do I give others than myself access to the app?Ask the person whom you would like to give access to download the app and initiate login. The administrator for the access will then be asked to verify the request for access.
  • What data is represented in the app?The credit card data for which you have an acquiring agreement with Nets Merchant Services is available in the app. Also the transactions and invoices data for which you have a terminal agreement is available in the app.
  • How do I contact customer service?Customer service can be reached here: www.nets.eu/payments.
  • How do I see data for other points of sale under the same organisation number? On all screens, you can see all of the point of sales under the same organisation. You can select upto 20 point of sales at a time.
  • How do I see turnover in other currencies? The turnover can only be viewed in the currency of the country your point of sale is based in.
  • Where can I see aggregated data for all of my point of sales?On all screens, you can select upto 20 point of sales at a time and you will get the aggregated data.
  • Can I see transactions which are pending?It is not possible to view transactions which are pending.

• When is my data available in the app? You can see your transaction and settlement data in the app at 10 am the day after the transactions.
  • Where can I find more details on my settlement? Please log in to Merchant Portal on merchantreporting.nets.eu/nets to find more details on your settlement.
  • How do I get access to the Merchant portal? Merchant Portal can be accessed here: merchantreporting.nets.eu/nets. Please follow the guide for how to log in or create access.
  • Can others see my data if they know my company organisation number? It is only possible to access the app if the administrator has provided access. You cannot log in just by typing the company organisation number.
  • How do I give others than myself access to the app? Ask the person whom you would like to give access to download the app and initiate login. The administrator for the access will then be asked to verify the request for access.
  • What data is represented in the app? The credit card data for which you have an acquiring agreement with Nets Merchant Services is available in the app. Also the transactions and invoices data for which you have a terminal agreement is available in the app.
  • How do I contact customer service? Customer service can be reached here: www.nets.eu/payments.
  • How do I see data for other points of sale under the same organisation number? On all screens, you can see all of the point of sales under the same organisation. You can select upto 20 point of sales at a time.
  • How do I see turnover in other currencies? The turnover can only be viewed in the currency of the country your point of sale is based in.
  • Where can I see aggregated data for all of my point of sales? On all screens, you can select upto 20 point of sales at a time and you will get the aggregated data.
  • Can I see transactions which are pending? It is not possible to view transactions which are pending.

• Terminal
  • How can I order Accessories?Go to the section ‘Business’ > ‘Shop’ in your portal. Here, you can select the accessories fitting your products.
  • CCV Mobile Terminal A920 - Is there a charging station for this terminal?Yes, the Mobile A920 can be charged using this or directly via USB C connection. The cradle, plug and USB cable are included.
  • CCV Mobile Terminal A920 - The flash memory can be expanded by 32GB, which cards have been tested or are recommended?The terminal was tested with a ScanDisk 32GB. For a smooth and fluent use, at least class 10 is recommended.
  • CCV Mobile Terminal A920 - Which pens can I use for the operation, is there a recommendation from Nexi?We have a CCV Touch Pen that we recommend for example for the CCV Base Next.
  • CCV Mobile Terminal A920 - What happens if I insert a 16GB microSD card larger than the recommended 16GB (the manufacturer says 32GB is possible)?It is recommended to use it as "portable memory". Tested with a 64GB ScanDisk
  • CCV Mobile Terminal A920 - Is there a carrying case?In the last votes, we have to provide a carrier bag and a silicone protective cover as accessories. As soon as these are available they will be added to our accessories list.
  • CCV Mobile Terminal A920 - Where can I get App's from?Apps are available in the App Store directly on the Mobile A920. We are constantly working on expanding the available apps.
  • CCV Mobile Terminal A920 - Is there a vehicle connection (plug and/or cable)?No, since the battery is charged via the (included) USB cable, you can use the USB ports in the car or a commercially available USB cigarette lighter adapter
  • CCV Mobile Terminal A920 - Can I obtain the microSD card from Nexi?Due to the rapidly falling prices for storage media, Nexi does not offer microSD cards, but recommends purchasing them from electronics retailers.
  • Why can I not accept tips on my Verifone Terminal?"To be able to add a tip to your transaction on a Verifone terminal you need to have an A920 Terminal for the same outlet (point of sale). If you have a Verifone terminal and the A920 you may need to manually enable the Tip on the Verifone terminal. To do this: Go to main menu (icon with 4 parallel lines at the bottom of start screen) Go to ""Administration“ menu Go to ""Merchant“ menu and enter your PIN (remember the default PIN is 000000’) Go to ""Card data“ option Go to ""Tip“ option Choose ""Yes“ on ""Allow tip“ screen"
  • I need a new terminal. How can I order a new one?You can order additional terminals in our webshop in your portal. Go to ‘Business’ > ‘Shop’, select the terminal you would like to order, confirm your order and the terminal will be delivered to your outlet.
  • Where can I track the delivery of my terminal?After your successful terminal order, you will be able to view a tracking link on your online Portal dashboard.
  • CCV Mobile Terminal A920 - Where can I get new receipt/paper rolls?You can order new paper rolls at any time by phone or on our website https://login.nexi.de, after logging into the SMARTPAY portal.
  • CCV Mobile Terminal A920 - Does the Android version correspond to the Android of my mobile phone?No, it is a special Android version that takes into account the high security requirements of a payment terminal. This is called a hardened Android version.
  • CCV Mobile Terminal A920 - How do you update the apps and the Android operating system?Updates are made available in the App Store. You will receive a message about available updates on your Mobile A920 and can choose the time of the update yourself. After three months a mandatory update will be made to have the latest versions available. Until then, you have the possibility to install an update yourself to prevent disruptions to business operations.
  • CCV Mobile Terminal A920 - How long does the battery last in stand-by mode?As with your mobile phone, the battery life depends on the use and, if necessary, on apps running in the background and the availability of the wireless or WLAN network.
  • CCV Mobile Terminal A920 - Is there a display protection film similar to a mobile phone?A screen protector is available as an accessory and can be ordered online.
  • Contract
  • Where can I find my business data?The 'My Business' screen provides details about your company and you can select upto 20 sales location on this screen. You can view the terminal details for the selected sales locations in the section 'Terminals'. Also, the functionality of selecting sales locations is available on all screens.
  • Where can I find my Service agreement?On the Nexi portal (https://portal.nexi.de/), the section ‘Business’ > ‘Legal’ provides you access to your contract details.
  • Which Card types can I currently accept with my Nexi contract?On the Nexi portal (https://portal.nexi.de/), the section ‘Business’ > ‘Legal’ provides you access to your Service Agreement Details including Card type acceptances.
  • What is meant by PCI Compliance Regulations?The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) is a set of security standards designed to ensure that ALL companies that accept, process, store or transmit credit card information maintain a secure environment. Please see https://www.pcicomplianceguide.org/faq/ for more Information.
  • Where can I find the pricelist?On the Nexi portal (https://portal.nexi.de/), the section ‘Business’ > ‘Legal’ provides you access to your pricelist.
  • Where can I view the Terms and & Conditions?The section 'My Business' > 'About' > 'Terms and Conditions' provides you access to the Terms and Conditions. You may also visit our Website https://portal.nexi.de.com for General Terms and Conditions.
  • What is GDPR?"The EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is an EU regulation (applicable since 25 May 2018) that ensures the protection of the rights and freedom of natural persons in relation to the processing of their personal data, which is a fundamental right in the EU. More specifically, the GDPR regulates, in form of strict rules, the processing (i.e. collection, storing, transfer, deletion etc.) of personal data in all companies operating within the EU. Please visit the public pages of the EU for more information: http://ec.europa.eu/justice/data-protection/reform/index_en.htm."
  • I need a contract confirmation as document. How to proceed?On the Nexi portal (https://portal.nexi.de/), the section ‘Business’ > ‘Legal’ provides you access to your Service Agreement details. This page can be printed out directly from your own device.
  • Account Data
  • How can I change the name of my company?In order to change the name of your company, please contact our service center for support. Go to the ‘Support’ section in your Nexi portal ((https://portal.nexi.de), go to ‘Send us a message’ and select the category ‘Account data’ > ‘Change of company name/ ownership’.
  • How can I change my receipt text?In the future, you will be able to change your receipt text directly in your Nexi portal. Until then, we kindly ask you to raise a service request via the ‘Support’ section in your Nexi portal. Select ‘Account Data’ > ‘Other account data’ as a category and fill in your updated receipt text. Our service center will process your request for you.
  • How can I change my bank account details?Go to the ‘Business’ page in your Nexi Portal. Select the legal entity and edit your bank account details. It is possible to enter a future valid from date to ease bank account changes due to monthly/ annual closures or change of ownership. The current bank account stays active until the new bank account's valid from date.
  • Can I edit my account data?Yes, your user account can be changed on the ‘Account’ page in your portal. You can also change account data such as bank account and address details by visiting the ‘Business’ page in your portal.
  • Transactions & Payments
  • How can I refund a transaction? Go to ‘Transaction’ page in your portal, select the transaction you would like to refund, a side panel with transaction details will be displayed on the right. Press the button ‘Refund’, a pop-up window will open and you will be asked to confirm that you want to refund this transaction and click ‘Confirm’. The ‘Refund’ will be displayed in your next Activity Statements as well as appear as a negative transaction in the ‘Transaction’ area with the transaction type ‘Refund’.
  • Where can I find the amount that has not been paid out, yet? Please select the menu item ‘Business’. The top bar of this business Dashboard will display you the open transactions as well as the amount which has not been paid out yet.
  • How can I process defend / remedy a chargeback? This depends on the cardholder's dispute reason. We will always provide a letter explaining the dispute reason and asking for the required information / documentation. As the card schemes have set a fixed timeline for the dispute resolution process, the information / documentation must be submitted until the deadline mentioned in the letter. Information / documentation that is provided after that date might not be taken into consideration.
  • What is a Chargeback? A chargeback is the cardholder's dispute of a credit card transaction. The cardholder may dispute a transaction due to different reasons (e.g. fraud, merchandise/ service not received, duplicate processing). For the dispute resolution process, the card schemes have issued specific rules as to when a cardholder is allowed to dispute a transaction and what a merchant has to provide in order to remedy the chargeback. If a chargeback is valid and a merchant is unable to provide the required documentation, the chargeback must be accepted and the merchant's account will be debited.
  • Which Formats are supported to export my data?You can share or download the invoices and settlements in PDF format
  • Is it possible to do a partial refund in the Nexi portal? No, it is not possible, yet.
  • When do I receive my payments? Payment settlements take up to 2 business days. Your funds are paid out to your bank account after successful settlement. Depending on your bank, the transfer may take an additional 1-2 business days. Payments happen daily and you can get an overview of your payments on the ‘Payments’ tab in your Nexi portal.
  • What does EOD transaction mean?EOD means End Of the Day (Kassenschnitt). These are all transactions gathered for one day under a specific number.
  • Invoices, Statements & Dunning Letter
  • What is meant by total fee?The total of all fees, e.g. total of interchange fee, scheme fee and service fee (the separator is a point or a comma, depending on the language settings).
  • I forgot to make a terminal cutover. What will happen?If you forgot to do the terminal cutover, the transactions of the German domestic payment methods (e.g. Girocard) will not be submitted and therefore you will not receive the payments out of these Transactions. As soon as you do the terminal cutover the transactions will be submitted the next day. International Card Scheme Transactions (e.g. Mastercard, VISA) don't need a terminal cutover and will be captured automatically after our internal System cut-off in our Systems once a day and be prepared for the Settlement.
  • What is a terminal cutover?In order to submit the transactions of the German domestic payment methods (e.g. Girocard) you need to do a terminal cutover at the terminal. To support you our terminals are configured to do a daily automated terminal cutover between 00:00 and 01:00. This only works if the terminal is not switched off.
  • App Support
  • I receive too many notifications. How can I manage my notifications?You may toggle on and off notifications in the 'My Business' tab. Select Notifications from the 'My Business' tab and then select or de-select 'Allow notifications'.
  • Can I configure my Dashboard?Yes. Select ‘Edit Dashboard’ and select and/or deselect widgets. Your dashboard will adjust according to your selection
  • Which are my notification options?You may toggle on and off your notification preferences in the 'My Business' tab for the following: Improvements to the app, Promotional offers, Data update, News from Nets related to your business.

Terms and conditions for Nets MyPayments app, applicable from October 2017


Please read these terms of use (Terms of Use) carefully before accessing the Nets MyPayments App (the Service).


Acceptance

By accepting these Terms of Use, you (the Customer) confirm that the Terms of Use will govern your use of all functions and services available via the Service. The Terms of Use will, together with the service agreement you have with Nets or Nets’ group or affiliated company (Agreement), constitute an agreement between the Customer and Nets, defining the parties’ rights and responsibilities with respect to the Service. Nets shall for the purposes of these Terms of Use mean Nets Denmark A/S, Klausdalsbrovej 601, DK-2750 Ballerup. The Customer accepts these Terms of Use by using the Service.

Registration

To use the Service, the Customer needs to register and create an account in MyPayments Portala portal maintained by Nets (Portal) with a personal username and a password. The Customer may need to provide Nets with certain personal and other information when registering. Nets may verify the Customers email address before the account can be used.The Customer agrees to provide truthful and complete information when the Customer registers for the Service and to keep that information updated.

Trial Period

Parts of the Service may be offered on trial for a limited period. The content and duration of the trial period is determined by Nets. These Terms of Use govern the use of the Service also during the trial period.

Payment

Parts of the Service may be subject to charges, but no additional fees are levied for the use of Nets MyPayments app. Any part of the Service subject to charges is invoiced in accordance with the Agreement and the then-current Nets price list. In the event of termination of the registration, charges paid in advance are not reimbursed.

Intellectual property and license

All intellectual property rights to the Service, its contents and associated material, and to the copyright, trademarks and other intellectual property rights regarding the Service, shall belong to Nets or its licensors

Nets grants the Customer a non-exclusive, non-transferable license, revocable at any time at Nets\' sole discretion, to access and use the Service strictly in accordance with the Terms of Use.

Using the Service

The Customer must take due care to protect the username and password against misuse by others and promptly notify Nets about any misuse. The Customer must take the following precautions

when using the Service:

  • Lock your phone when you are not using it so that others cannot gain access to your data.

  • If you leave or lend your phone with or to other parties, you must log off the app.

  • If you leave or lend your phone with or to others for a longer period of time, you must delete the app. This also applies when you get a new phone or if it is sent for repair.

The Customer using the Service undertakes to comply with applicable legislation and regulations, in addition to the rules and other conditions stipulated in these Terms of Use or in other instructions from Nets.

The Customer shall only have access to its own information, statistics and analysed data, depending on the Customer’s subscription. Information or data accessed by the Customer via the Service shall only be used for personal purposes and the distribution or commercial exploitation of such data is prohibited. The Customer shall notify Nets immediately if the Customer discovers that the data the Customer is accessing does not belong to the Customer. The use of data accessed without authorisation may give rise to criminal and civil liability

The Customer is responsible for its actions and communication, as well as their consequences, in connection with the use of the Service. The Customer undertakes to use the Service only as intended. The Customer may not use the Service or its contents to provide similar or otherwise competing services.

The Service must not be used in a way that may damage Nets or Nets\' partners. The Customer is liable for any loss, claim or damage sustained by Nets, or by Nets’ group or affiliated company, as a result of the Customer’s misuse of the Service. The Customer additionally undertakes not to damage, deactivate, overload or adversely affect the Service (or the network linked to the Service), nor to interrupt the use of the Service by others, transfer, make available or otherwise disseminate any part of the Service to a third party.

The Customer is liable for all charges associated with the use of the Service.

Revocation

If the Customer suspects that access details have been compromised or that someone is misusing them, the Customer must immediately contact Nets to revoke access.

Availability and changes to the Service

The availability and content of the Service may vary and is subject to Nets’ sole discretion. Nets expressly disclaims any representation or warranty that any particular content or Service will be available. The Service may not be available in all countries and may be provided only in selected languages. The Service, operations and some features may also be dependent on the network, compatibility of the devices used and the content formats supported.

Nets may, in its sole discretion, change, correct or discontinue the Service in whole or in part. The Service may not be available during maintenance breaks and other times.

If the Customer is opposed to changes in the Service, the Customer is entitled to terminate its registration to the Service and must cease using the Service before the change takes place. If the Customer continues to use the Service after being informed of the change, the Customer is deemed to have accepted the change.

The Service may – temporarily and without warning – be taken out of use due to system faults, maintenance or repairs, or for reasons beyond Nets’ control.

Disclaimer of warranty and limitation of liability

The Service is provided on “as is” and “as available” basis. Nets does not warrant that the Service will be uninterrupted or error or virus-free. No warranty of any kind, either express or implied, including but not limited to warranties of title, non-infringement, Customer ability, or fitness for a particular purpose, is made in relation to the availability, accuracy, reliability, information or content of the Service. The Customer expressly agrees and acknowledges that the use of the Service is at the Customer\'s sole risk. Nets’ total aggregate liability during any twelve (12) month period shall not exceed an amount equal to the charges paid by the Customer within the preceding twelve (12) months for the Service or ten thousand (10 000) euros, whichever is lower.

Nets collects and uses your personal data in relation to your use of the Nets MyPayments app as indicated below.

Except for liability for death or personal injury caused by its gross negligence or intentional misconduct, in no case will Nets be liable for any indirect, incidental, punitive or consequential damages resulting from the Customer\'s use or inability to use the Service.

Changes to the Terms of Use

Nets may amend these Terms of Use at any time without prior notice. This is done by Nets publishing an updated version of the Terms of Use that the Customer must accept when the Customer logs on to the Service. The Customer can find the applicable version of the Terms of Use of the Service under \"Terms and conditions\".

When making material adverse changes, Nets must inform the Customer about the change(s) at least thirty (30) days before such change(s) take(s) effect. Nets is always entitled to make changes with immediate effect when these arise from legislation, regulations or other decisions by the authorities, including directions from the national and international card organisations. The same applies to changes to the Nets\' agreements, or its group or affiliated companies’ agreements, with the acquirers or issuers.

Termination

The Customer may terminate its registration if it no longer wishes to use the Service. After termination, the Customer will no longer have access to the Service. Nets may terminate the Customer\'s registration, or restrict the Customer\'s access to certain parts of the Service, if Nets reasonably believes that the Customer has breached the Terms of Use, or if Nets needs to shut down the Service entirely.Nets may choose to close the Service at any time, and in such case will as far as possible give notice of this three (3) months in advance.

The Customer may terminate its registration if it no longer wishes to use the Service. After termination, the Customer will no longer have access to the Service. Nets may terminate the Customer\'s registration, or restrict the Customer\'s access to certain parts of the Service, if Nets reasonably believes that the Customer has breached the Terms of Use, or if Nets needs to shut down the Service entirely.Nets may choose to close the Service at any time, and in such case will as far as possible give notice of this three (3) months in advance.

If the Customer deletes the Service from the Customer’s mobile device, this will be deemed termination of Customer’s use of the Service without further notice.

Assignment

Nets is entitled to transfer its rights and obligations in respect of these Terms of Use to a third party, either in whole or in part.

The Customer may not transfer its rights and obligations in respect of the Service without the written consent of Nets.

Notices

Nets may send notices to the Customer in the ways described in the Service. The Customer undertakes to study the content of notices sent to the Customer by Nets. Notices sent by e-mail are deemed to have been received by the Customer three (3) days after the date on which they were sent. Notices posted within the Service are considered to have been received by the Customer seven (7) days after the publication date.

Privacy and confidentiality policy

Nets collects and uses the Customer’s personal data in relation to Customers use of the Service as indicated below.

Nets collects data about the Customer’s mobile device and the Customer’s use of the Service to prevent misuse of the Customer’s company\'s data. In order to increase user-friendliness and the expansion of this Service, Nets also collects statistical data showing how the Service is used for Nets own use. Customer’s data will not be used at an individual level, but will be collected in anonymised statistics that Nets uses to further develop the Service.

The privacy policy made available on the frontpage of the Service governs the use of personal data.

Applicable law, legal venue and disputes

Disputes arising in connection with these Terms of Use will be settled by a court of domicile of the Nets entity the Customer has entered into Agreement with and in accordance with the law of the country of the competent court, excluding applicable conflicts of law rules.

Customer service

If you have any questions about the Service, you can contact Nets\' customer service.

These Terms of Use enter into force beginning on [10.06.2021] and shall remain in force until they are replaced by new terms of use.

See how you can get more licenses for Tap To Pay

MyPayments is developed by Nexi Group to support you and your business. Learn more about Nets as a part of Nexi Group https://www.nets.eu/nets-nexi.


With MyPayments you can:
 • Get support setting up your terminal
 • Easily track you card turnover
 • Identify peak operational hours during the week
 • Discover which countries your customer are from
 • Keep an eye on your customers’ loyalty
 
Get in touch when you need help
Here you can view information related to your statements. You can also view invoices from Nexi, if available.\n\nPlease log on to www.nexi.de to find more details on your statements.
Are you sure you want to proceed?
Once the software license is assigned to this device and a specific sales location, it cannot be undone without contacting our customer service.
By confirming, you are agreeing to associate this license with your phone.\n\nThis action cannot be undone without contacting our Customer Service.
Activate your Tap To Pay license for this device?

Here you get an overview of the business' peak hours, measured on either card turnover or number of transactions.

It is possible to change the time span from day to week or month.

The colours show how busy the different periods are. Red means highest amount of transactions, yellow means medium and light grey means lowest amount of transactions.

Value of your customer\'s aggregated purchases within the period\nHere we look at the total value of business a consumer has brought to your sales location, combining repeat visits during the period. The insight is showing the different categories of spend and the number of consumers in each spend range. The long tail of the graph will highlight the biggest spender who brought in the most value.
You need an iPhone to use Tap to Pay on iPhone
Apply to all in this location

Here you can see your business' average purchase amount.

It is possible to change the view to show figures per month, week, day or hour.

The darker bars show the current year, while the lighter bars show figures for same period last year, where available.
The user can\'t authenticate because no biometric or device credential is enrolled.

Here you can see your business' card sales, number of transactions and average purchase amount.

It is possible to change the view to show figures per month, week, day or hour.

The darker bars show the current year, while the lighter bars show figures for same period last year, where available.
We will be in contact with you shortly.
Overview of transaction pattern for new and recurring customers

Here you can see turnover and average purchase amount for new customers compared to recurring customers.

It is possible to change the time span from week to month or year.

In the graph, it is displayed which figures represent new and recurring customers. It is also possible to get insights into spending patterns for recurring customers with 5+ visits over the past 12 months.
Enter the Business partner ID of the company
Enter your Business partner ID to get e-mail hint send to your e-mail address
Business partner ID must be a number between 3 and 15 digits
When you start to transact and use your terminal(s), data will start to appear in the app.\nIt is also possible to see your transactions on your terminal(s), see below.
Transaction data from some terminals can take 1-2 days to appear in the app.\nIf you have Nexi SoftPOS terminal(s) you can see your transactions immediately.
When will my data show up?
If you need to check a terminal transaction immediately you can do so on the terminal. Please consult your terminal guides on how to find your terminal’s transaction history.
View your transactions immediately on your terminal
The transaction data speed of arrival can depend on a few factors.
When to expect your data to be visible in the app

Get Tap to Pay on iPhone
Open the app with the list symbol to be able to cancel a payment.
Your transaction list will now appear. Tap on the transaction you would like to cancel.
Tap on the Void button in the lower right corner.
Tap the Yes button on the pop up to confirm the cancellation of the transaction.
Tap on the Close button to finish the process.
Lift up the printer cover on top of your terminal by pressing on the sides.
Remove the old paper roll and replace it with a new one. The new paper roll should face down so it touches the display. Pull it out a bit to make sure there is some excess paper left.
Replace the paper roll with a new one
Close the printer cover until you hear a click sound. Rip off the excess paper and perform a test transaction to make sure printing works smoothly.
Open the app with the list symbol to find the transaction you would like to print a receipt for.
Your transaction list will now appear. Choose the transaction you would like to print the receipt for.
Tap on the Receipt button in the top right corner.
Tap on the Print receipt button to print a physical receipt.
Open the app with the terminal symbol to be able to accept payments.
Use the numeric pad to enter the amount of the transaction. Press the Charge button to confirm.
Let your customer complete the purchase by using their payment card or digital wallet.
Let your customer complete the purchase
If your customer would like the receipt, click on the Paper receipt, if not, click on the No receipt button.
Share the receipt with your customer
Open the app with the list symbol to be able to refund a payment.
Your transaction list will now appear. Choose the transaction you would like to refund.
Tap the Return button in the lower right corner.
You can choose to refund the full transaction amount or make a partial refund. Confirm by tapping the Refund button in the lower right corner.
Let your customer complete the refund by using the same payment card as they used for the purchase.
Let your customer complete the purchase
If your customer would like the receipt, click on the Paper receipt, if not, click on the No receipt button.
Share the receipt with your customer
Use the numeric pad to enter a small amount. Press the Charge button to confirm.
Complete the test transaction by using your own payment card.
Try printing a customer receipt by selecting the option for a paper receipt on the terminal screen.
Insert the power cable on the left side of the charging base and the other end to a wall socket.
Place the payment terminal onto the charging base to start charging the terminal.
Place the terminal on the charging base
Hold the power button for around 2 seconds until the screen lights up.
Select your preferred language and tap the Continue button.
By tapping \'Activate\', your terminal will be set up to accept payments through Nets\' & Nexi\'s payment application Npay.
Confirm the terminal ID and business information by tapping the Yes, continue button.
Create a secure 6-digit pincode to get started.
Tap the I agree button to confirm the terms and conditions by our partner Poynt GoDaddy.
Open the app with the terminal symbol to be able to receive payments.
Open Tap to Pay on Android device by tapping the NEXI SOFTPOS menu option.
Use the numeric pad to enter the amount of the transaction. Tap the Charge button to confirm.
Your customer can use a payment card by holding it on the back of the phone. See next step in this guide for more purchase options.
Let your customer complete the purchase
Your customer can also use a digital wallet or smart watch by holding it on the back of the phone. In some cases, it might ask for a pincode.
Let your customer complete the purchase
If everything goes right, the payment will be completed and will automatically show you the receipt in the next step.
Share the receipt with your customer by tapping the sharing icon in the top right corner of the screen.
Share the receipt with your customer
Choose the sharing option that your customer prefers to receive the receipt.
Tap the X icon in the top left corner to return to the purchase screen.

If you\'ve recently noticed that you\'re unable to use the Tap To Pay on iPhone feature on your phone, there may be a simple explanation. This feature will automatically be disabled when your battery level falls below 5%. The purpose of this is to conserve enough battery life and prevent your device from running out of power in the middle of a payment.

With Tap to Pay on iPhone in the MyPayments app, you can accept in-person, contactless payments with only an iPhone — from physical debit and credit cards, to Apple Pay and other digital wallets. No extra terminals/readers or hardware needed. It’s easy, secure, and private.

To begin with, tap the payment card on the iPhone screen and then present your iPhone to the customer. Tapping the payment card will flip the card to the customer view, allowing them to see the price of their purchase.

To complete the purchase, your customer can now hold their card or device horizontally at the top of your iPhone, over the contactless symbol. The transaction is complete when you see the “done” checkmark.
Once the transaction is complete, the receipt will occur on your screen. The receipt can easily be shared as your customer wishes. Through e-mail, phone number or even WhatsApp or AirDrop.
In Transactions, you will be able to view and track all your receipts. When you click on a transaction you’ll see the receipt details and here you can also share the receipts with your customers.

Tap to Pay on iPhone uses the built-in features of iPhone to keep your business and your customer data private and secure. When a payment is processed, Apple does not store card numbers on the device or on Apple servers, so you can rest assured knowing your business stays yours.
Tap to Pay on iPhone is now available for you. Click \"start\" to go through a small guide of how it works.
Tap To Pay on iPhone is disabled when the internet is gone. Try to reconnect the network again.
To accept payments with Tap to Pay on iPhone, tap Nexi SoftPOS.
Use the numeric pad to enter the transaction amount. Press the Charge button to confirm.
Request your customer to place their contactless payment card horizontally or Apple Pay or other digital wallet over the contactless symbol.
Tilt the iPhone towards your customer; the screen automatically rotates, enabling your customer to view the transaction details.
Screen rotates automatically to face the customer

Let your customer complete the purchase. The PIN entry screen will be automatically prompted for contactless card payments that require customers to enter their card PIN. Accessibility Options are also available if required.
PIN Entry with Tap to Pay on iPhone

ACQUIRING FRAMEWORK AGREEMENT - ADDENDUM REGARDING NETS SOFTPOS – TAP TO PAY ON iPHONE

1. INTRODUCTION AND BACKGROUND

1.1 The Parties have entered into an acquiring agreement (the “Agreement”).

1.2 The Parties have agreed that Nets, in addition to the acquiring services stipulated in the Agreement, also delivers Nets SoftPOS – Tap to Pay on iPhone (as defined below) to the Company. This Addendum governs, together with the Agreement, Nets’ delivery and the Company’s purchase of Nets SoftPOS – Tap to Pay on iPhone (as defined below).

1.3 In order for Nets to deliver Nets SoftPOS – Tap to Pay on iPhone to the Company, the Company needs to accept the terms and conditions of this Addendum by clicking submit to the we agree checkbox. Once the Company has agreed and submitted its acceptance of this Addendum, Nets will deliver Nets SoftPOS – Tap to Pay on iPhone solution to the Company.

2. INTERPRETATION

2.1 The defined terms in the Agreement shall have the same meaning in this Addendum unless otherwise is stated.

2.2 This Addendum forms an integrated part of the Agreement and modifies only the Agreement, including the Terms, in respect of the matters included herein.

2.3 In case of discrepancies between the text of this Addendum and the text of the Agreement, the text of the Addendum shall prevail.

3. Nets SoftPOS

3.1 General

3.1.1 Nets SoftPOS – Tap to Pay on iPhone consists of a mobile payment application and backend system which can turn an iPhone (as defined below) into a contactless payment acceptance point of sale.

3.1.2 For the avoidance of doubt, it is noted that Nets SoftPOS – Tap to Pay on iPhone can only be used with Nets’ Acquiring Services and does not come with cash register services/software.

3.1.3 Nets may, without the Company’s prior written consent, use subcontractors to deliver Nets SoftPOS – Tap to Pay on iPhone to the Company.

3.2 The Tap to Pay on iPhone Application

3.2.1 The Company can download the Nets SoftPOS – Tap to Pay on iPhone application from the App Store onto an iPhone X or a newer model.

3.2.2 Nets is not affiliated, associated, authorized, endorsed by, or in any way connected to the App Store (or Apple), and is not responsible for the use or function hereof.

3.3 Use of Tap to Pay on iPhone

3.3.1 Nets grants the Company a limited non-exclusive right to use Tap to Pay on iPhone in accordance with the terms and duration of the Agreement and this Addendum. The Company shall, at all times, follow Nets’ written instructions on the use of Tap to Pay on iPhone solution.

3.3.2 The Company shall not modify, change, or copy Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone.

3.3.3 The Company shall only use Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone for its points of sale in such countries agreed with Nets.

3.4 iPhone

3.4.1 Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone only works on iPhones X or a newer model. The iPhone must have a working and enabled NFC reader and use the newest iOS (the “iPhone”).

3.4.2 The Company must acquire the necessary iPhones and bear all costs related hereto, and Nets shall not be responsible for the functionality of the iPhones.

3.4.3 The IPHONE must have an embedded NFC antenna and run on a supported version of the iOS. The iPhone must run on a version of the iOS as instructed and approved by Nets.

3.4.4 It is required that each iPhone has online connectivity to function, which the Company is responsible for. The Company shall bear all costs in connection with the use and operation of the Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone, e.g., electricity, online connectivity, and consumables.

3.5 Security

3.5.1 Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone in MyPayments App entails the performance of payment transactions on one or more EMV payment networks. Nets is entitled to block transactions if Nets suspects that the security of the iPhone is compromised. This could happen from rooted devices, suspicious apps installed on the device, usage patterns, etc.

3.5.2 After the activation of Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone on the applicable IPHONE(s), all IPHONE(s) must at all times be monitored and supervised by the Company and the Company’s representatives. The iPhone must not be used as an unattended payment terminal.

3.6 Updates of Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone

3.6.1 The Company shall continuously update the MyPayments App to ensure the right level of functionality and security. Any use of a software-version older than the latest versions shall be at the Company’s own risk. The latest version and supported version of Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone must be downloaded from the App Store, unless otherwise notified by Nets.

3.7 Data Collection

3.7.1 Nets shall be entitled to collect data to improve performance and functionality of Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone and perform relevant analysis.

3.8 Suspension

3.8.1 Nets shall be entitled to suspend the Company’s use of Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone, if the Company breaches the Agreement, including if the Company has unpaid due fees.

3.9 Special limitations and special terms and conditions during the Initial Period

3.9.1 Continued development of Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone will be ongoing during the calendar year 2024 and 2025 to achieve integration and adaptation of other features and functions of the product (below referred to as the “Initial Period”).

3.9.2 The Company is aware of and accepts that Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone during the Initial Period is subject to the following limitations until Nets notifies Company in writing or otherwise:

3.9.2.1 Limited availability and support: Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone is made available and supported on a best-effort basis during the Initial Period. Nets will provide the Company with contact details for inquiries related to the Initial Period; and

3.9.2.2 Nets can at its own discretion decide to terminate or suspend the delivery of the Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone at any time.

3.10 Territory

3.10.1 The Company shall only use Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone for its points of sale in %@ (the “Territory”).

4. AFFILIATES

4.1 An Affiliate of the Company is entitled to order and use Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone in accordance with the terms of the Agreement. In such case, the Affiliate is bound by and shall comply with the terms of the Agreement as if the Affiliate was the Company. In such cases, invoice for use of Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone will be sent and paid by the Company.

4.2 The Company is liable for an Affiliate’s orders, acts, or omissions as it is for its own debts, acts, and omissions.

4.3 For the avoidance of doubt, only Affiliates located in and with points of sale in the Territory can use Nets SoftPOS - Tap to Pay on iPhone under this Addendum.

5. PRICES

5.1 The Company will not be charged extra for the Nets SoftPOS Tap To Pay on iPhone solution, but the commercial agreement is subject to be revised one year from acceptance of the Addendum.

6. PERSONAL DATA

6.1 As Nets is the acquirer, the Company and Nets will be independent data controllers. I.e. no Party processes Personal Data on behalf of the other Party.

6.2 As part of delivering Nets SoftPOS - Tap To Pay on iPhone, Nets will process Personal Data of individuals who are customers of the Company. The Personal Data include transaction data, including card and other payment data. Information on Nets’ general handling of Personal Data is stated under section 4 (Data Protection) of Appendix 2 (General terms and conditions) of the Agreement.

7. TERM AND SIGNATURE

7.1 This Addendum enters into force upon the Company’s acceptance of the Addendum in the MyPayments App and remains in force until terminated by a Party either as set out in this Addendum or the Agreement.

7.2 Each Party can terminate this Addendum with 3 months' written notice to the other Party with effect from no earlier than the end of [date]. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if Nets stops its cooperation with Apple on the Tap To Pay on iPhone, Nets shall be entitled to terminate this Addendum with 6 months’ notice.
